posts.post_content:
Still better than [Sorrow's Path](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorrow's Path), [Wood Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wood Elemental), [Break Open](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Break Open), and their ilk on the sole fact that at the very least, casting it isn't (usually) detrimental to you. At worst it's just a spell that does practically nothing.  
  
That said, its uses are extremely limited, and I don't know why you wouldn't just play [Tormod's Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tormod's Crypt) and/or [Rakdos Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Charm) if you really wanted to wipe out all lands from someone's graveyard.
posts.html:
Still better than Sorrow's Path, Wood Elemental, Break Open, and their ilk on the sole fact that at the very least, casting it isn't (usually) detrimental to you. At worst it's just a spell that does practically nothing.

That said, its uses are extremely limited, and I don't know why you wouldn't just play Tormod's Crypt and/or Rakdos Charm if you really wanted to wipe out all lands from someone's graveyard.

Posted By: Kaleidostorm (8/1/2013 7:47:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wow, so many haters, I'm shocked this card doesn't have a higher rating.  
I actually think this card is really useful, for several reasons. I run an Izzet storm/draw deck with a mana curve of almost solely 1, 2, and a few 6 cmc cards. Because the deck is purposefully designed to make you mill like crazy, I pack it with resets like [Time Reversal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Reversal) and [Elixir of Immortality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elixir of Immortality), which will both help you draw more, and keep you from killing yourself. In a longer match I'll usually hit about thirty cards in the graveyard and start resetting by turn eight to ten, the problem at this point is cycling my mana ramp. When I hit the reset I wind up with all of the [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse)s, [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds) and [Scalding Tarn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scalding Tarn)s in my hand, when all of my mana is already in play. These cards are now the only thing preventing a win, because they keep me from drawing till a nuke like [Grapeshot/autoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grapeshot/autoc)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Because the deck is purposefully designed to make you mill like crazy, I pack it with resets like Time Reversal and Elixir of Immortality, which will both help you draw more, and keep you from killing yourself. In a longer match I'll usually hit about thirty cards in the graveyard and start resetting by turn eight to ten, the problem at this point is cycling my mana ramp. When I hit the reset I wind up with all of the Terramorphic Expanses, Evolving Wilds and Scalding Tarns in my hand, when all of my mana is already in play. These cards are now the only thing preventing a win, because they keep me from drawing till a nuke like Grapeshot/autoc... (see all)
